marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: We view Danantara's investment plan as aligned with the authority's focus on eight sectors, including mineral downstreaming. For TPIA, Danantara and INA's involvement in the CA-EDC project will provide capital support, giving TPIA room to develop other businesses.

marketNews.title: Other Hot Topics to Know
marketNews.content:
1. Finance Minister Sri Mulyani said on Tuesday (17/6) that the 2025 state budget recorded a deficit of 21 trillion rupiah or 0.09% of GDP over the five-month period ending May 2025 (versus a 4-month surplus of 4.3 trillion rupiah), with a primary surplus of 192.1 trillion rupiah. State revenue over the five-month period reached 995.3 trillion rupiah (-11.4% YoY) or 33.1% of the 2025 target, while state expenditure amounted to 1,016.3 trillion rupiah (-11.3% YoY) or 28.1% of the target.
2. Economic consensus expects Bank Indonesia to keep the BI Rate at 5.5% in the Governing Board meeting on Wednesday (18/6), according to a Reuters survey. The consensus also forecasts a 25-50 basis-point cut by the end of 3Q25.
3. Director General of Customs and Excise Djaka Budi Utama said on Tuesday (17/6) that the excise tax on sweetened packaged beverages (MBDK) will not be implemented this year. He did not give reasons for the postponement but said all policies, including MBDK, will always consider economic conditions. Earlier in 2025, the Customs Communication Director Nirwala Dwi Heryanto had indicated MBDK would be applied in the second half of 2025.
4. The United States and the United Kingdom have agreed to the trade terms announced in May 2025, cutting US tariffs on UK exports and raising the UK quota for US agricultural products. The deal includes a 10% tariff exemption on UK civil aircraft imports and reduces the UK automotive import tariff from 27.5% to 10% in June 2025, with an annual quota of 100,000 units. The US will also exempt the UK from a 25% steel tariff up to an unspecified quota. The UK commits to US requirements on reliable steel and aluminium supply, including ownership issues of steel plants.
5. Kontan reported that tobacco-industry players—from farmers to workers—are asking the government to impose a three-year moratorium on tobacco excise hikes. SPSI chairman Sudarto said the postponement is realistic to protect labor-intensive tobacco sectors, while APPTN coordinator Samukrah stressed the moratorium is vital for farmer sustainability.
6. Remala Abadi ($DATA) signed a working-capital loan facility of up to 220 billion rupiah from Bank Mandiri ($BMRI). The facility matures in 12 months.
7. NFC Indonesia ($NFCX) plans a private placement of about 66.7 million new shares, resulting in a 9.09% dilution. Pricing and investors have not been disclosed. Proceeds will be used for investments to support the company's development. The plan will be discussed at the extraordinary shareholders meeting on 18 June 2025.

marketNews.title: Beli Saham = Beli Kepemilikan?
marketNews.content: "If the answer is >10 years, I will buy and hold; if not, just take the profit." - JPH668

tickerNews.title: TPIA: Danantara & INA Plan to Become Investor in CA-EDC Plant
tickerNews.content: BPI Danantara and the Indonesia Investment Authority (INA) said on Tuesday (17/6) that they have signed a memorandum of understanding worth USD 800 million with Chandra Asri Pacific ($TPIA). Under this MoU, Danantara and INA will explore the possibility of becoming new investors in a chlor-alkali and ethylene dichloride (CA-EDC) plant. The plant, to be operated by TPIA’s subsidiary PT Chandra Asri Alkali, is targeted to have an annual production capacity of 400,000 metric tons of caustic soda (sodium hydroxide) and 500,000 metric tons of ethylene dichloride. TPIA director Edi Rivai said the company allocated capex of IDR 8.8 trillion for 2025, focused on building the CA-EDC plant. The project is already in the process design stage, and PT Chandra Asri Alkali has signed a three-year salt off-take agreement with BCI Minerals Limited for raw material supply. Previously, TPIA and INA signed an MoU in 2023 that allowed INA and potential foreign investors to explore purchasing shares of PT Chandra Asri Alkali. PT Chandra Asri Alkali also signed a letter of intent with PT Indonesia Asahan Aluminium (Inalum) covering a potential wet caustic soda supply of up to 120,000 metric tons per year and a possible equity participation by Inalum of up to 10%. In a separate transaction, Aster Chemicals and Energy – a joint venture between TPIA and Glencore – announced it has signed an agreement to acquire the entire ownership of a condensate splitter facility and related assets from PCS Pte. Ltd. in Jurong Island, Singapore. The transaction value was not disclosed. Aster also plans to revitalize the facility, increasing its total oil processing capacity from 237,000 barrels per day to more than 300,000 barrels per day. Earlier, Aster announced a plan to acquire Chevron Phillips Singapore Chemicals, which currently operates a polyethylene plant with a capacity of 400,000 tons per year in Jurong Island.

tickerNews.title: GOTO completes buyback of 32.2 billion shares worth Rp2.1 trillion
tickerNews.content: $GOTO: GoTo Gojek Tokopedia announced that it has completed a buyback of approximately 32.2 billion shares with a total purchase value of about USD 130.8 million or IDR 2.1 trillion, completed by 11 June 2025. This represents roughly 65 % of the total buyback allocation of USD 200 million and implies an average purchase price of about IDR 65 per share. The bought-back shares will be allocated to an ESOP/MSOP program. GOTO plans another buyback with a fund allocation of up to USD 200 million or IDR 3.3 trillion between 19 June 2025 and 18 June 2026, to be discussed at the shareholders’ meeting on 18 June 2025.

tickerNews.title: KKGI shareholders approve final dividend 2024 of 15 IDR per share
tickerNews.content: $KKGI: Shareholders of Resource Alam Indonesia approved a final dividend for fiscal year 2024 of IDR 15 per share, indicating a final dividend yield of 3.8 % as of Tuesday (17/6). Previously, KKGI also distributed an interim dividend of IDR 15 per share in January 2025.

tickerNews.title: AMRT revises 2025 new store opening target to 800 stores
tickerNews.content: $AMRT: Corporate Secretary of Sumber Alfaria Trijaya, Solihin, said the company has revised its target for opening new stores in 2025 from the original 1,000 stores to 800 stores (actual openings in 2024 were 1,033 stores). The adjustment reflects a change in management outlook for the retail industry in 2025.

tickerNews.title: CTRA approves 2024 dividend of IDR 24 per share
tickerNews.content: $CTRA: Shareholders of Ciputra Development approved a dividend for fiscal year 2024 of IDR 444.85 billion, equivalent to IDR 24 per share. This corresponds to a dividend payout ratio of about 21 % (same as 2023) and a dividend yield of 2.4 % as of Tuesday (17/6). The cum-date is on the regular and negotiation markets on 25 June 2025, with payment on 18 July 2025.

tickerNews.title: INTP reports 4 % YoY decline in May cement sales but market share rises to 29.5 %
tickerNews.content: $INTP: Indocement Tunggal Prakarsa recorded a 4 % year-on-year decline in cement sales volume in May 2025, while its market share increased to 29.5 % (May 2024: 29.3 %; April 2025: 28.2 %). The decline was driven by a broader industry contraction of 4.6 % YoY. Bag-type cement sales fell 1.3 % YoY and bulk cement sales fell 10 % YoY in May 2025. Management explained that there has been no significant increase in infrastructure projects in Java and the new capital city (IKN). Over the five-month period to May 2025, INTP’s sales volume fell 2.1 % YoY (5M24: +10 % YoY), in line with the industry-wide 2.1 % YoY decline (5M24: +2.8 % YoY).

tickerNews.title: BUMI major shareholder Chengdong Investment sells ~2.53 million shares
tickerNews.content: $BUMI: Chengdong Investment Corporation, a major shareholder of Bumi Resources, sold approximately 2.53 million BUMI shares at an average price of IDR 122 per share between December 2024 and June 2025. The transaction value was about IDR 308 billion. After the sale, Chengdong’s ownership in BUMI fell from 10.68 % to 9.99 %.

tickerNews.title: CTBN declares 2024 dividend of IDR 530 per share
tickerNews.content: $CTBN: Citra Tubindo will distribute a dividend for fiscal year 2024 amounting to approximately IDR 424.2 billion, or IDR 530 per share. This equals a dividend payout ratio of about 99 % (2023: 0 %) based on an exchange rate of IDR 16,300 per USD, and a dividend yield of 7.5 % as of Tuesday (17/6). The cum-date is on the regular and negotiation markets on 19 June 2025, with payment on 15 July 2025.

tickerNews.title: WIKA records new contract value of IDR 3.37 trillion in 5M25, down 62 % YoY
tickerNews.content: $WIKA: Wijaya Karya’s company secretary, Ngatemin, said the firm recorded new contract values totaling IDR 3.37 trillion during the five-month period to May 2025, a decline of 62 % year-on-year.

tickerNews.title: DKFT announces interim dividend of IDR 10 per share
tickerNews.content: $DKFT: Central Omega Resources will distribute an interim dividend for fiscal year 2025 of approximately IDR 55.1 billion, or IDR 10 per share. This equals 40 % of DKFT’s 1Q25 net profit and implies a dividend yield of 2.1 % as of Tuesday (17/6). The cum-date is on the regular and negotiation markets on 25 June 2025, with payment on 7 July 2025.

tickerNews.title: DATA secures working-capital loan of up to IDR 220 billion from BMRI
tickerNews.content: Remala Abadi ($DATA) signed a working-capital loan facility of up to IDR 220 billion from Bank Mandiri ($BMRI). The facility has a maturity of 12 months.

tickerNews.title: NFCX plans private placement of ~66.7 million new shares
tickerNews.content: NFC Indonesia ($NFCX) intends to conduct a private placement of approximately 66.7 million new shares, resulting in a dilution of 9.09 %. Pricing and investors have not been disclosed. Proceeds will be used for investments to support the company's development. The plan will be discussed at the extraordinary shareholders meeting on 18 June 2025.
